1.title: EURECOM – Engineering School
1.description: Computer engineering student, specializing in embedded systems and artificial intelligence.

volley.title: Website for Sophia Antipolis Inter-company Volleyball Association (A.S.I.E volley)
volley.description:
As part of a redesign project, I modernized the official website of the Association Sportive Inter-Entreprises de Sophia Antipolis (A.S.I.E.), dedicated to organizing their annual volleyball competition. The original site, built in PHP, suffered from an outdated structure and a design no longer suited to current needs. I therefore undertook a full redesign, rethinking both the interface and the features to better meet the expectations of players and organizers.

This project allowed me to work on several key aspects:

  • Secure authentication: implementation of a login system based on React Context on the frontend with password validation handled directly by the backend (Node.js + MySQL), ensuring robust user management.
  • User experience: design of an intuitive and responsive interface tested across different screen sizes (smartphones and desktops), streamlining court reservations and championship information access.
  • Client collaboration: regular discussions with the head of the volleyball section to understand his needs, present intermediate builds, and adjust development to match his vision.

Finally, this project was also an opportunity to work on multi-platform deployment using free and reliable services (Vercel for the frontend, Render for the backend, Aiven for the MySQL database).

Through this work, I strengthened my skills in web app redesign, secure authentication, UX design, and project management with a real client.

portfolio.title: My Portfolio
portfolio.description:
My portfolio site is a showcase project allowing me to present my technical achievements in an elegant and accessible way.
It was designed with particular attention to readability, graphic consistency, and smooth navigation, both on desktop and mobile.

  • Strengthening my foundations in modern frontend development
  • Improving my use of TailwindCSS
  • Applying best practices in responsive design
  • Regular evolution of the site alongside other projects

sqlrewriter.title: SQL Rewriter
sqlrewriter.description:
SQL Rewriter is an automatic SQL query rewriting tool, developed in Python during my internship at Worldline (LIQUIDITY team).
Its main goal: ensure compatibility between Oracle and PostgreSQL by transforming Oracle-specific queries (NVL, (+), DELETE without FROM, etc.) into standard SQL queries.

The tool automatically analyzes and modifies source files (.c, .pc for Pro*C, .sh, .sql), then saves a transformed version in a dedicated directory.
To facilitate review and quality control, an interactive HTML report is generated:

  • Navigation by file and rewrite status (successful or abandoned)
  • Side-by-side presentation of original and modified queries, with visual diff
  • Display of transformations, original line, and error messages in case of failure
  • Search bar to quickly filter report queries

Skills developed: parsing, complex text manipulation, web report generation, managing large-scale code transformation projects in an industrial context.

SQL Rewriter was developed during my internship at Worldline. The code belongs to the company and cannot be shared.

rasbello.title: Rasbello
rasbello.description:
Rasbello is a modern and accessible version of the Othello game, designed to run smoothly on Raspberry Pi.
Mainly developed in Python with PyQt, the game uses multithreading to responsively manage its different modules (interface, voice, AI, network).

  • Multiple controls: mouse or voice commands, trilingual support (French, Italian, English)
  • Powerful AI: adapted version of Egaroucid (best open-source Othello AI), C++ engine optimized for Raspberry Pi, Python/C++ interface
  • Online multiplayer: play against other human players or let the AI play for you (innovative online mode)
  • Artistic direction: handmade pixel art, multiple resolutions, customization options (board, pieces, etc.)
  • Accessibility & modding: executable version for easy installation, modding guide to add/modify features or visual content

gauntlet.title: Gauntlet of Sight
gauntlet.description:
Gauntlet of Sight is a portable assistive device for visually impaired people.
Designed as a smart glove, it integrates a camera in the palm, a microcontroller with haptic feedback (precision vibration motor), and a spatial audio system via headset.
Goal: indicate the position of obstacles in the nearby environment, intuitively and unobtrusively.

Obstacle detection: Fine-tuned version of YOLOv5, trained on a hybrid dataset

  • 5% real photos of obstacles to recognize
  • 95% synthetic images generated with Blender API Python (3D model in different angles, lighting, visual contexts)

The optimized model runs locally on a Raspberry Pi, ensuring lightweight and autonomous execution, without the need for a remote server.

The glove integrates all hardware components: camera, haptic motor, Raspberry Pi board, power supply.
Thanks to this compact integration, GOS offers a discreet, mobile, and economical solution for greater autonomy for visually impaired people.
